problem_text:
Is a free pro-p-group representable by matrices over an associative-commutative profinite ring with 1?
A negative answer is equivalent to the fact that every linear pro-p-group satisfies a non-trivial pro-p-identity.
This is known to be true in dimension 2 for p ̸= 2
(A. N. Zubkov, Siberian Math. J., 28, no. 5 (1987), 742–747). It is also proved that a 2-dimensional linear pro-2-group in characteristic 2 satisfies a non-trivial pro-2-identity
(D. E.-C. Ben-Ezra, E. Zelmanov, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 374, no. 6 (2021), 4093–4128).
A. N. Zubkov, V. N. Remeslennikov
